meanings.definition: To have a sharp, pointed projection.
meanings.sent1: She tanged the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The chef tanged the knife into the cutting board.
meanings.sent3: The superhero tanged the villain with a laser beam.
meanings.sent4: The idea tanged in her mind like a sudden realization.
meanings.sent5: The cat tanged its claws into the scratching post.

meanings.sent1: The metal ruler felt tanged against his skin.
meanings.sent2: The orange juice had a tanged flavor that made her pucker.
meanings.sent3: The tanged smell of the sea filled the air at the beach.
meanings.sent4: His words had a tanged effect on her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The spicy chili had a tanged kick that lingered on his tongue.
